Summary: This place has daily housekeeping, free shuttle, free breakfast , free parking and  location close to disneyland walkable about 15 mins. This place needs to work their plumbing issues, low  water pressure and bathtub drains very slow
Manager Response: none

Summary: The only positive is that it’s close to the park. Shower drain was clogged a bit and water pooled while showering, we asked for it to be fixed and our message was ignored. dirty sink, “clean” towels weren’t clean, bed sheets never changed, just made up. Shuttle is convenient but only comes early in the morning and late at night.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The only positive was how close it was to Disneyland. The complimentary shuttle barely travels back and forth to Disney and it's tiny. The sink smelled like sulfur. There was random metal sticking out from bed. The toilet paper was zero ply. The shower temp was lukewarm at best.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest-  Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and Suites on Harbor Boulevard and for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. We know that you have choices in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always stay with us in the future.  Sincerely, The Management and Staff

Summary: A great place to stay! A short drive to the Disneyland Parking garage, about a 15min walk to the park, nice and clean property. our go to stay for our California trips. we are planning another trip soon and will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Wishing for a good night sleep
Summary: While the rooms are acceptable for the price you pay, nothing overly exciting or above average. Just your standard motel room with no frills. Stayed in room 103, terrible of you want a quiet night. The room is located next to the after hours check in and there is noise, bells ringing and people talking at all hours of the night. Woken up by loud conversation multiple times after 1am. Informed the staff and nothing changed. Breakfast is extremely average, choice of toast, waffle or 3 types of cereals. Recommend going to the supermarkets and getting breakfast supplies. Overall. . I disappointing stay due to the noise, inability to get a good sleep as a result and the below average breakfast options.
Manager Response: Dear Nathan-  Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and Suites on Harbor Boulevard and for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. Summary: We had multiple flights cancelled to get to our reservation here, unfortunately because of this we got there a day late. When we called to let them know they still charged us said there was nothing they could do which was unfortunate. When we finally got there they had cancelled our entire reservation and the man at the front desk argued with us about our reservation. We were in a rush to get to a hockey game so we just said whatever and he rebooked us, it was at a slightly higher rate than we originally booked for which was frustrating. Our room was okay, mostly clean, but very run down. The door was very hard to open and you basically had to body slam it to get it open. The breakfast was a decent continental with cereals, fruits and waffle makers. The shuttle was a great

Summary Heading: DO NOT COME HERE MOST DISGUSTING PLACE ON EARTH
Summary: DO NOT COME HERE AT ALL COSTS!! WORST EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD!! I booked a 3night stay for my family to spend time at Disney. Unfortunately this was only hotel available at the time of booking. I have had stayed at other days inn and experience was okay not bad…but this one here is the worst experience I have ever had In My life!! We checked in everything seemed fine and they were welcoming. The minute we walked in the room we noticed nothing was clean. The walls were very dirty black and brown stains with boogers and food stains, eye lash left next to sink!! How do you miss that!!??  So we complained they said sorry but didn’t seemed bothered as if it was normal to them and supposedly upgraded us ..ended up being same room type just literally next door. Manager walked in
Room tip: DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME HERE!! DISGUSTING PLACE!!

Summary: Called ahead to see if pool was heated. Front desk said yes pool is heated and spa is working. When arrived pool was ice cold and the jets on the spa do not work. I understand if the pool isn't heated but don't lie to people about it. I was just passing thru so the pool was a big deal for us. Also bed has a huge hole from over use so room 123 queen bed is terrible

My daughter wanted to sleep on the Sleeper sofa.  We pulled it out and found 2 moving bugs.  Closer look at the bed we found another.  We quickly Picked up our belongings and checked out.  Staff once again was quick and friendly but did not seemed surprised at what I found, didn’t even ask to see the pictures I took.

Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights. The rooms are spacious and clean with the added bonus of a sofa bed. Free parking and breakfast. They had a free shuttle bus to bus but this was a mini bus so not very big, we missed the first bus on our first morning and when it returned we thought we could get on but it didn’t leave for another hour so we decided to walk. It’s around a 20 minute walk to Disney. We would go to the parks early and return around lunchtime to chill in the room and go swimming to cool off and then back to Disney in the evening. Breakfast was good, a choice of toast, cereals, freshly made waffles, fruit, microwaveable muffins, tea, coffee and orange juice.  A couple of downsides there’s a petrol (gas) station next door and you could hear people locking their cars ( US

Summary Heading: Good for a cheap price and close to Disney!
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights specifically to visit Disney. First off the walk is max 15 minutes to the front gates of Disney (ignore reviews that say longer than this, I think they have mixed the hotel with one of a similar name). There is also a shuttle bus but it does fill up quickly but will come back for you if you don't want to walk. The room is extremely basic, for example there is no safe in the room. However, our room (222) was on the second floor and was clean, spacious and quiet. There was also air con in the room, a hairdryer, fridge and TV. There is noise when some people come back from the park later than you, but what can you expect that's not the hotels fault! For the price we paid I think this hotel does what it needs to do!

Summary: Heads-up that though it Carrie’s the name Anaheim at Disneyland Park, this DAYS INN location is in no-way walking-distance to any entrance of Disneyland. It is 1 hr and 35mins WALK or 14 MINUTES DRIVE to Downtown Disney District or to Disneyland Hotel(Magic Way). Shuttle will not be provided all the time. When I called to inquire at noon time, I was told that the next shuttle to Disneyland will be at 5:30pm.  But for an affordable quick-stay, DAYS INN by Wyndham in this location is good enough having a newly-renovated room. Carpet seemed newly vacuumed and walls are still white and clean. Toiletries are provided. I just hope there will be complimentary bottled water. I’m writing mainly to personally acknowledge YOLANDA PABLO and Allison at the Breakfast Waffle Station of Days
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest-  Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and Suites on Harbor Boulevard and for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. We are so happy to have you let us know the name of employees that have really stood out - customer service is our main goal to the customer.  We are sorry that you thought it was misleading to Disneyland - we are .6 miles over the bridge to the front entrance.  Thank you for all of your comments!  We know that you have choices in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always stay with us in the future.  Sincerely, The Management and Staff

Summary Heading: Definitely not up to Wyndham standards
Summary: Before booking this hotel for a 1 night stay, we called to see if we could leave our vehicle parked the next day while we went to the park, and were told yes. That's why we chose this hotel. Upon arrival the man at the check in desk was very rude. We told him how we had been told our vehicle could be left there the following day, he basically accused us of lying because we couldnt provide the clerks name that we had spoken to, and he said he could allow us 1 extra hour or the vehicle would be towed. Once we arrived at our room, the door was wide open and there was furniture on top of the bed. We went back and told him about it and he replies that they cleaned the carpets and we could just close the door. He said nothing about furniture being on the bed. We told him we would like

Summary Heading: Gnats, mildew, and a double charge
Summary: Stayed two nights. The first night we had a late check (the front desk is 24hr). We got stuck with a room that was full of large gnats and a very strong mildew odor. I've gotten a smelly room at this location before (the gnats were new), but the last time they accommodated us and moved us to another room immediately. This time, however, we called the front desk to get a room change and no one answered. The next morning we noticed that the smell had gotten stronger through the night, so we complained and the staff member did not seem surprised or apologetic at all. I paid for that night with points, but my credit card was charged anyway. I called the front desk for a refund and was charged again instead. I filed a complaint case with Wyndham and got an email from the manager: a

Summary: An excellent place for all our Disneyland and beach trips. 15min walking distance. A short drive to the Disney parking garage. This property is always clean, rooms are always welcoming, staff is great, perfect all around place to stay. We will definitely be returning on our next trip.

Summary: Man at the front desk was very rude and had a lot of attitude. Me and my husband traveled separately because he was working out of town and the man basically said my husband had to park his car elsewhere, when I was willing to pay for an extra parking. And during my stay there was a ton of parking open which I was willing To pay extra for. Yet he was very rude when I had asked him about paying extra

Thank you for your understanding.  We know that you have choices in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always stay with us in the future.  Sincerely, The Management and Staff

Summary: This hotel was a clean place with a continental breakfast, but the shuttle service left me wanting more. They don’t advertise the 7 hour gap in the shuttle service from 10:30am to 5:30pm, which is prime time Disneyland time. And a walk from the hotel to Disneyland takes awhile.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest-  Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and Suites on Harbor Boulevard and for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so pleased that you had a great stay with us. The reason that we have a gap is because most guests do not utilize the shuttle during those times; we try to have it available during the times that most people want to go back and forth.  You can always ask the front desk to see if it is possible to have a trip for a large group or with someone that is unable to make the walk.  Thank you!  We know that you have choices in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always stay with us in the future.  Sincerely, The Management and Staff

Summary Heading: Meh, close to Disney but not worth it
Summary: The room was dirty, particularly the carpets, and there were insect pests that bit us while sleeping. The breakfast was a big disappointment—mostly old packaged snacks. You could hear the guest walking above our room at all hours of the night. The property is located on a very busy road that was difficult to navigate. The only nice aspect was the proximity to Disneyland and the friendly staff. However, I will not be coming back or recommending to others.

Summary: Very close to Disneyland park. The service was great overall. The only down side was they included a cost for breakfast and it was just a sack of granola bar, muffins, and an apple. Rooms were very clean, and the maids gave us what we needed when we asked.

Summary: For the price, you can’t complain! We were on the second floor and it was very quiet, we only heard children running in the morning. Everything was clean. Breakfast was in a to-go brown paper bag. It consisted of an apple, kool-aid juice, blueberry muffin, and granola bar.   They have a shuttle once an hour that goes to Disneyland, or you could walk over in about 10-15 min.   Only odd thing was that my shampoo was opened and used but was the only option on the sink.   Overall, it was a great stay. We saved money and were able to get some sleep.

Summary: I felt really disappointed. It was our second time staying there. We were there on 2018 and it was a totally different experience. Staff at the front desk is not friendly or informative. We were not told at any time that they do not clean the rooms, when we asked why, they used covid as an excuse and told us that we had to inform that we wanted our room cleaned, which we did and found out the next day that didn’t clean it anyway. They only provided clean towels.  The breakfast is a bag with an apple, a juice and very bad bread.   It feels like they are using covid 19 as an excuse to save costs on everything.  The only nice experience was with the shuttle staff, who are very friendly and service oriented.
Manager Response: Dear Alex -   Thank you for staying at the Days Inn on Harbor Blvd. and for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. Please know that the cleaning is now in line with the industry standard - it is "on demand". Simply call the front desk the day of arrival and we can schedule the cleaning for the next day for you. We will talk to the housekeeping staff to see why they did not clean.  Thank you for letting us know your situation.  We know that you have choices in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always stay with us in the future.  Sincerely, The Management and Staff

The breakfast wasn’t so bad but some mornings I wanted a hot breakfast. The shuttle was perfect for transportation to and from the park that was a big bonus

Summary: The room was dirty. Bugs came out of sink. Their idea of breakfast is to hand you a bag with high sugar cheap food. For example, hostess brand sweet roll, a high sugar granola bar, a bottle of sunny delight and a small apple.   Their shuttle to Disneyland runs late and there are long gaps when it doesn't run at all. Had to Uber back during one 3 hour gap.   Parking is minimal with few amenities.

Summary: I had to post after reading all the negative as tive reviews. Was this place the Ritz... no but it was clean and cost about HALF of what other places near Disneyland were charging. The rooms were clean and comfy with all the amenities I needed. There was a free shuttle and parking was also free.......and did I mention it was about half as much as other hotels in the area.

Summary: The hotel is close enough to Disneyland that we could walk. We also used the hotel shuttle, which was very nice and on time. We enjoyed grab and go breakfast. There was no room service, so our room wasn’t cleaned and materials were not restocked. We tried to ask for more cups but staff was rude. They also apparently ignored another guest who was trying to ask for more towels. Overall, a good hotel for Disney. We felt safe and the property was clean.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest-  Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so pleased that you had a great stay with us. Please know that our cleaning is the new nationwide standard of "on demand" - simply call the front desk to schedule cleaning for when you are gone and to get any supplies.  We are so sorry that you were not informed at check-in.  Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention.  We know that you have choices in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always stay with us in the future.  Sincerely, The Management and Staff

Summary: I don't think I will be coming again to this hotel . I felt that the staff are not too friendly . The room was not clean enough . The parking is so limited . I was worried through the time of my stay if I had to come back late at night will I be able to find parking .

They only decent thing is the distance to Disneyland but the morning shuttle driver kept showing up late.

The AC could only be set to 69 What a JOKE, and the AC smelled HORRIBLE.  The snack bar in the lobby cost more that crap INSIDE the parks AND could not pay cash or even charge items to my room.  I will NEVER stay here again and will post every where I can about how terrible this place was!!! The only positive I can say about this place is it had the

The elevator smelled funny and it rained while we were there and the ground in front of the stairs and rooms were slippery. It was ok for a night, especially for the price by Disneyland, but I would not stay there again.

Personally it just feels too pricy for how the room was.

Summary Heading: Good for a quick Disneyland trip

The redone rooms are nice and come with a large refrigrator and microwave.  Right now breakfast is a grab and go but does have more than other hotels.  The pool is clean and well kept.  Parking was an issue late at night especially for large cars and trucks.

Garbage outside of the rooms were pouring over onto the ground, just because COVID is going on, there should be no reason why they can’t keep the property nice and clean. Beware of the $200 deposit, they don’t post it on their website.

Summary Heading: has gone down since last here
Summary: We had a free night stay so we decided to use it, we chose this place since we had been here in 2014 and it was close to everything. Big mistake!!The quality has gone down!!! They advertise on the web site free breakfast, that is not done and I can understand because of the virus, but here in NM the hotels give you a grab n go bag with bottle of water, fruit snack, and granola bar. They advertise a swimming pool, that has a yellow tape across gate to not enter, we were in Phoenix and their pool was open and you could use at your own risk. They have a sign by the check in window that they like you to read and it talks about modified maid service, LETS SAY NO MAID SERVICE for 3 days. They could have come into at least empty the trash for that was over flowing and give us fresh

Summary Heading: Good if you are on a budget and want to be close to Disney
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights. Rooms are ok.  Enough room for the 3 of us.  A little couch, separate sink to the bathroom.  A little closet space.  Beds were comfortable.  Breakfast was included.  Waffles are nice, coffee awful.  The hotel is 10mins walk to Disney.  You walk over a bridge and busy road to get there.  There are some restaurants near the hotel, Taco Bell, Starbucks and a pizza place.  But most of them are over the bridge closer to Disney.  Hotel has a shuttle that runs several time’s throughout the day.  Was good for the price.  If you have the opportunity to stay on the other side of the highway closer to Disney it’s better but otherwise this is a good choice if you are looking for cheap, clean accommodation close to Disney.

We were able to park the car there (for FREE) & walk to the park.  Our room was clean and dark and the beds were comfortable.  The bedding & decor have been upgraded since the last time I stayed there. We slept through the free breakfast, but they gave us a discount coupon for Denny’s.  I would stay here again!

Shuttle runs on a very strict schedule only a few times in the morning and a few times at night but not all day or every hour. The room was affordable with fridge and microwave. Everything else was updated and clean.

Nothing in the room worked at all: the TV, the microwave, the refrigerator - none of them would even turn on. Front desk was of no help for any of that or for the wifi which had such a weak signal we could barely check email. We now know there are better hotels for the same price in the area - just dig in with your research.

Room was clean, staff was friendly, hot tub was nice, bed was comfortable, price was great.  Will stay again.

Summary: This hotel is good for the price.  Breakfast is very basic but free.  Shuttle is also free but doesn’t run all day. There are usually more people than the van can hold. We walked to Disneyland every day instead. Free parking in the hotel lot.  Close by but you do have an overpass to cross so it’s a chore for people who don’t walk a lot.  If you want to save money and don’t need frills, this hotel will do.

Breakfast was good - cereal, yogurt, waffles, and toast. The hotel is right on the main road, but we didn't hear the traffic. The pool looks nice - we didn't have time to play in it. Great stay for the price, will stay there again.

The rooms are tired at best white bed spreads show red blood spots as soon as u see them. The wall in the shower shows stains and looks dirty. The a/c at closer look has mold growing on it and it’s leaving the mold smell everywhere.

Summary: I booked two nights at this hotel but was never emailed confirmation for my stay, so the night that I needed the hotel I couldn’t remember which hotel I booked at and ended up booking at a different hotel. The only way I figured out which hotel I book at was when in the following morning my credit card was charged for two nights. When I called to ask for a refund they refused since I didn’t cancel 24 hours in advance... I feel like I’ve been scammed!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Days Inn when you need a place to stay.    That being said, it is industry standard practice that for all hotel bookings, cancellation needs to be made ahead of the arrival date - some hotels ask for 48 hours advance notice.  Because you could not remember where you booked, you are asking us to eat the cost of an unused room during high season.  We most definitely did not "scam" you - you booked a room, did not show up (for whatever reason) and then want us to absorb the loss?  Huh.    We are sorry that you did not like the idea of taking ownership of your own mistake, but we cannot be held responsible for what you did or could not remember.  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: Me and my family loved the room. Are next trip we want the same room. We loved the distance where are room was at. And how it had free  shatter to Disneyland and from Disneyland.  Also the available restaurants.

The staff were very friendly and very helpful, and the free shuttle to and from Disneyland was good and it saved our feet after a long day at Disneyland.  The free Breakfast in the restaurant was a great start of the day.  Highly recommend and would return when I’m next visiting Disneyland.

Nice and close to Disneyland, And Knott’s berry farm. Very clean, nice staff. We had a great time here and would definitely come again. Big room with one of the comfiest king beds we have ever slept in. It was also a huge bonus that they had a Disneyland shuttle. Icing on the cake. Thanks again!

Summary Heading: Perfect for a 3 day break for Disneyland
Summary: Very nice motel with rooms were perfect for a 3 day stay, Breakfast was very good and always someone on hand to make you fresh waffles at your request, Fruit, cereal, cakes, scrambleld eggs, toast, coffee and tea etc to get you started for the day. ~They have a shuttle to Disney but it only take 15 mins to walk so not required.  Pool was good but bizarrely in the middle of the car park. Only used it at night up until 10 am as at Disney all days. free parking. You can watch Disney fireworks from the pool too. We found the best restaurant opposite the disney resort which was magnificent. It's in a shopping precinct and is called Fire & Ice. $20 for an eat what you like buffet. You select your food take it to the huge cooking plate in the middle of the room and watch the guys cook

Summary: Despite checking with the hotel and the front desk when I checked in, my son was not permitted to park in the hotel parking lot under threat of towing. At 1:30 AM, I had to find overnight parking for my two adult sons. The manager was a complete A-hole and refused to honor the parking request. I booked a three queen suite which was just an oversized room with an auxiliary AC unit that has seen much better days. The room needed repair and the extra door lock was broken. My suggestion is to skip this place and stay somewhere else. Also, The free breakfast was awful so you won’t save any money by staying here.
Manager Response: Dear Howard -   Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property.  We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so sorry that you did not have a great stay with us.  Please know that we have never allowed anyone to have an extra car parked in our lot, especially during peak season.  We have a lot that has exactly one spot per room and so we have to keep that in mind, always.  We are sorry that you seemed to get the wrong message about the parking.  We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Days Inn when you need a place to stay.  Please come back soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: This hotel was amazing, the rooms where a great size, easily fitting 4 people per room. The rooms were clean. The staff were always helpful and friendly. The location is perfect- easy walk to Disneyland and restaurants.The pool was ideal to cool off after a long day at the theme parks. Definitely recommend to others.

Very clean, comfortable bed and the bathroom. Breakfast very good, I will not say that it was WOW, but enough and tasty. We didnt use the shuttle for Disney park as we had another program to Anaheim. Parking lot was large enough and we didnt experience a lack of space to put our car, at any time of the day. Thanks to the workers of this motel.

The only thing is that the wi-fi can be a little hard to access& I wish that the bathroom door was solid instead of vented(like 5 open slits) for a little more privacy while using the bathroom. Other than that , I would book again& I'm very pleased w/ my stay.

Summary: Only complaints here are the breakfast was okay, could've been better. Also, the wifi was a bit slow. Other than that, this place is fantastic for the price. The room was updated and extremely clean. The staff was nice and the location can't get any better. There's a bus stop right outside the hotel, and two other ones close by if you're looking to use any shuttles to get to Disneyland. Hotel does offer their own shuttle, but it's a van and doesn't fit that many people. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and will be making more reservations for future trips to Disneyland!

We know that you have choices in lodgingwhen it comes to the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Days Inn for your vacation needs.  Please come back soon! Summary: I always choose another place when I go to Disney, but I thought i’ll Change this time. It was terrible, they asked me to upgrade to the room that has castle bunkbed and I did, as I thought the kids will love it, but the room and the bathroom are horrible. I literally had sleep myself to have the night pass and leave in the morning. Not clean and the quality is horrible. Then we had to get into the parking issue. Anyway, will never go there again.

We will look into the housekeeping issue and see what happened.    We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Days Inn to make your vacation base.    Please come back soon! Summary: The hotel was clean and staff was pleasant. You can hear when someone above or next to you in another room takes a shower. It's very loud. It's a non smoking hotel which I appreciate. The other guest were rude. If you want to get much sleep I suggest bringing ear plugs. The location was very convenient. Just a short walk to Disneyland and restaurants. The shuttle never was running on time. It was a few minutes ealry or late almost every time. It's not a first come first serve, its whoever fights there way on first type of thing.

We know that you have choices in accommodations here in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Days Inn for your lodging needs.  Please come back soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: This is a great location only a few minutes away by shuttle to the Disneyland park. rooms and pool clean and enjoyable. Staff are nice and happy to help , breakfast is hot and ready to eat each morning. our grand kids and son's family had a wonderful time using the pool and felling safe in the court yard.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property. Summary Heading: Poor Customer Service/ No Internet/ Stay Elsewhere
Summary: Upon our arrival to this hotel/ our dates were mixed up by a third party booking. The Manager - Ziaul Islam Syed- verbally attacked me at the front desk with my 11yr old son watching - as I was trying to get this figured out.  We were booked in for 5 days/ booked out for 1 night/ and then booked back in for a night we didn’t need.  After his total frustrations on me - He told me he was ‘refusing my business’ after just arriving from Canada. (It was spring break & he couldn’t comprehend what had happened through someone else’s booking)  He then went on to say I told him to ‘shut up’.  I did not.  I have much more respect than that for my Elders.  I would never even say that to my son.  He kept over talking me and blaming Me for booking my days wrong when I couldn’t get a word in
Manager Response: Dear Cheryl -   Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property.  We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so sorry that you had a less than stellar stay with us here at the Days Inn.  Our manager was mostly worried at the beginning that you were using a Wyndham membership number that would not get points on your behalf, the credit card that did not work at the beginning and also about the matter of the booking dates.  The situation escalated rapidly after that and for that we apologize profusely. The manager was really most concerned about righting all of the incorrect items and should have focused on customer service.  We hope that you will give us another chance to show you how nice your stay could be here at the Days Inn.    Sincerely, The Management

Summary: The best thing about this place was the closeness to Disneyland and the price. I understand you get what you pay for but the breakfast needs more options!! Only fruit for four days was bananas and only white bread for toast option!! Waffles were good and lady making them was very friendly!
Manager Response: Dear Charnj -   Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property.  We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so sorry that you did not have a stay that exceeded your expectations.  We are in the process of adding food and changing our breakfast - we hope that they will be ready next time you visit.  We know that you have options in lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Days Inn for your hotel needs.  Please come back soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary Heading: Nice but don't rely on shuttle service.
Summary: Nice hotel. Nice front desk service. Shuttle experience was disappointing. Other guests can be bullies. Even though we hoped for a ride back after long day, had to walk due to guests pushing and arguing.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property.  We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so pleased that you had a great stay with us.  We apologize for your poor experience with the shuttle - we will ask the drivers to be more cognizant of problems and try to help more.  We know that you have choices in lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Days Inn for your vacation needs.  Please come back soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: We had to book an extra night and had to drop to a lower class hotel due to lack of availability so I was prepared for a dirty and tired hotel, but I was wrong.   This hotel was freshly refurbished, clean and generous.   We didn’t use the shuttle to go back to Disney but it was only $5 in an Uber there and we ended up walking home(probably about 15mins).   The breakfast was generous and a bonus. Coffee, juice, cereal, toast, fruit, yoghurt, scrambled eggs and freshly cooked waffles by the lovely lady in the dining room.   We also had to wait until 2.30pm to access a room which wasted a bit of time having to trf from our other hotel at 11am. We just went and grabbed lunch and came back.   The beds were comfy and pillows were firmer than most hotels (which I love).   My only
Manager Response: Dear Carolyn -   Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property. We know that you have choices in lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Days Inn for your vacation needs.  Please come back soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: This hotel has a van NOT A SHUTTLE. The van picked us up late from disneyland after a long day of walking with toddlers.  We were starving and tired and they were crying. He was late to get us . We were out there earlier. That means we waited over a hour and we left the park early waisting precious paid time at disney just to be sitting outside anyways. When the shuttle van got there there wasnt enough room for us he had to come back to get us. It took about another 45 minutes.  He was a terrible driver. We did not want to be stuck at the park again so we ended up buying parking passes which was more money out the pocket for the remaining time we had at disney. That morning i called and complained and the front desk girl called me early asking why did i complain with a attitude.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property.  We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so sorry that you were not satisfied with your stay here with us.  Please know that our complimentary van holds 15 people at a time and we always go back for passengers that were waiting there.  From what the driver told us, the traffic was busy that day and he was doing his best to get back, but you were not there anymore.    We know that you have choices in lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Days Inn for your needs.  Please come back soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary Heading: Disneyland within steps of the hotel
Summary: My daughter and I stayed here during spring break and it was the best place we have stayed in so far. The room was clean and beds are perfect. Never a problem and housekeeping was the best. The one thing I would say, I always back and powercord with multi outlets. It came in handy this trip. The outlets are worn and very loose.

Summary: everything was good room was easy to get to and get in . i love that room was easy for handicapped person to get in.office staff was kind and helpful.it     was located in the perfect spot where we went to disneyland

Summary: We primarily travelled from Canada to catch some sun, watch some Anaheim Ducks games, and travel around the area.   This hotel is a prime and cheap location to travel to Disneyland. They offer free shuttle services to get there, a walkable distance if needed, plus a bus stop right outside the hotel to get you around. (we did not go to Disneyland ourselves).  The hotel staff were great, really pleasant and helped give us some activity ideas as well where to get some good eats which included a lot nearby.  The room was a good size, clean, one king bed, toilet and shower in the bathroom and sink outside of it. The shower had decent pressure but always made a noise starting up which was probably due to the amount of use the other showers were getting used. No safe in the room, but
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property. Summary: Loved the property.  Very accommodating.  It was a short walk to Disneyland Park.  The breakfast was great and the gal working breakfast on March 5 & 6 was so sweet.  We will book this property next year.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: Happily impressed by the wonderful service and amazing hotel room
Summary: I booked this days inn for the easy access off the I-5, cheap rates, free breakfast and free parking and then I read the reviews here and got scared!  However, we just spent our week there and I'm happy to say that we had an excellent stay!  The front desk staff were friendly and accomodating, the breakfast room lady was wonderful, we somehow got room 218 which was 'wow' because the bunk beds were made to be a castle and my daughters LOVED it.  Everything about our stay was great, thank you!!

Summary Heading: Our go to Hotel for a Disneyland trip
Summary: as always this place is perfect when we visit Disneyland. its got what we needed for our stay, a quick drive or walk to Disneyland, clean rooms, great pool for the family, and breakfast to get you on the go. we will definitely be staying here again for our future Disneyland trips. it really helps if your a Wyndhams member.

Summary Heading: Nice, clean hotel about 1/2 mile from Disneyland
Summary: Very nice hotel, with marvelous staff. About 1/2 mile from Disneyland , but they have a shuttle. (Shuttle hours are a little scattered, however, there is a bus stop right in front of hotel, with 2 busses that go very near where shuttle drops off, most of the day-schedule on line and at bus stop). It’s not a bad walk, also! Hotel has free breakfast, is no smoking, and has free parking.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property. Summary: Rude lady in the breakfast area,  the coffee is bad, the room is clean and  comfortable, they have free shuttle to Disney in the morning and evening , or you can walk 20 minutes to Disneyland, they need better vacuums and clean the filter of the heater because my dust allergy went crazy when I was in the room too bad because it was a good price for the room

We just did a deep cleaning of the carpet and the rooms so we are very worried about the allergies that you had while staying with us and will look into it.   Thank you for bringing these issues to our attention.   We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Days Inn whenever you visit.   Please come back soon! Summary Heading: Terrible property and terrible customer service
Summary: Terrible hotel very old rooms and noisy, I arrived early morning after a long flight from Sydney I told him I’m happy to pay extra if you can make me a room ready and he was so rude and say just leave your bags and go to Disneyland or wait until 3pm I stay in the lobby until 11am and I saw so many guest check out early he could easy get HSK to get a room early and check me in so I left for a walk and back at 2pm and still not rooms to check in I’m sure at that time most of the rooms are ready to check in but his very rude reception and he check me in just after 2pm, very disappointing never again
Manager Response: Dear Chris -   Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so sorry that you did not have a great stay with us.   Early check-in is a problem for us because we are not a large hotel that has a lot of extra bedding.  No excuses, however, we  DO want to make our guests comfortable.  We will see what happened and make sure that this doesn't happen again.    We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always stay at the Days Inn when you are here.  Please come back soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: Please note they do not do magic morning shuttle service. They also have a small bus for about 12 people that only runs one time per hour. Also did not realize they take a 3-hour break in the afternoons with no shuttles at all. Not a good selection for breakfast and the hot tub was cold!

Then when I finally checked in I asked for a quiet room and he gave me a room that faced the main Street with the loudest neighbors next door, whatever. The main reason I'm posting this review is because I had a coworker delivering some paperwork for me, as soon I my coworker walked into my room this guy at the front desk called me to threaten me saying that I only paid for 1 guest and they don't allow visitors he even said

Rates are good, rooms have always been clean, they have a shuttle to and from the park, rooms have a fridge, and micro. I just wish the continental breakfast was just a bit more better.

Summary: Approx 15 minutes to front gate. Interesting walk by back entrance to Disneyland and through hotel area, Downtiwn Disney and cultimating at park entrance at Disneyland and California Adventure. I enjoy walking si dudnt mind the long trek daily. If you dont like to walk you wouldn't like it. Tio:Take monorail from Tomorrowland to Downtown Disney and save time. I really only slept here. Nothing special. Nothing much for continental breakfast either. Come on guys.

Summary: Our room was nice and what we expected however we found old food, dirty socks, used plastic eating utensils and old juice boxes behind the nightstands and beds. Dead insects in the bathroom light fixtures and cockroach sightings. Breakfast was not worth our time. No fruit or proteins were offered. Cold cereals and breads were 99% of what was offered. The shuttle to Disneyland only makes one trip per hour at very limited set times. The shuttle only has space for 15 and one of those is the driver. Walls and floors are poorly insulated and it sounded like a heard of elephants were dancing around over our heads as we were on the first floor. Yes there was internet but it was barely enough to check e-mail. We spent 5 nights here and we will not stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property. We know that you have choices when it come to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always stay at the Days Inn when you are vacationing here.  Please come back soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: Close hotel, clean and recently updated, gave us the option for upstairs or downstairs, ample parking space although they closed the 5 spaces under our room the last day, there was still available parking. Just want more shuttle times from 12:30-5:30pm as we like to take a break from the park but do not want to wait til 8:30pm to go back. Awesome clean hotel and affordable. $6 Uber ride if you don’t use shuttle to park. Easy check in and checkout, pool, housekeeping was great. Better thank I expected!
Manager Response: Dear Stefanie-   Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property. Summary: We stayed here for a trip to Disneyland. It is about 30 minutes to the park and the price was very reasonable. The room was notable larger than most budget motels and was clean and well furnished and supplied with the standard amenities. They also had a continental breakfast with the standard fares - waffle maker, dry cereal, fruit, pastries, coffee, apple and orange juice, etc. If you're looking for an inexpensive, comfortable night's sleep it is fine. I downgraded them one star because the WiFi wasn't working
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was very pleasantly surprised by our stay here.  We arrived after a long, long day and the front desk was very friendly.  The only bummer was that the hallway on the second floor really stunk like smoke.  I was worried our room would stink, but it didn't and it was roomy and clean!  The breakfast was also better than expected.  The woman working the breakfast room kept everything clean and stocked.  She was so nice and friendly.  I would stay here again, people were very nice!!
Manager Response: Dear Martha-  Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and taking the time to rate and provide information about our hotel. We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve our customer service and our facilities.  We are so pleased that you had a great stay with us here. We know that you have a choice when staying in the Disneyland area and we hope that you will always stay at the Days Inn during your visit.  Please come back soon!  Sincerely The Management

Summary Heading: Great location for a Disney trip
Summary: Couldn't have asked for a better spot for a stay near Disneyland.  Great staff, nice rooms, good wifi.  Convenient for walking to the park (when we didn't want to use the free shuttle) and a few area restaurants.  Just wish that the breakfast had offered some non-sugary cereals, real orange juice, and non-styrofoam cups and bowls.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -  Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property. Summary: We booked our trip months in advance and due to unique needs of our family we requested a ground floor room. When we checked in we were told there were no ground floor rooms available and there is no elevator. The desk clerk was very rude and said that our request did not matter and that we should have called that morning. When I asked how I should have known that, especially if I had already put in the request months in advance he said there was nothing he could do. There were several unoccupied ground floor rooms with the windows open and no personal items in the rooms. When I asked about these rooms he said they were already checked into. All those rooms check into with no personal items and the windows opened?! When asked why the request was not honored he said the people
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -  Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property. Summary: I read alot of reviews regarding the woman at breakfast watching them. Your right she does, to see if you need anything, to see if she can help with anything. Pay attention people and tip for goodness sake. Also the hotel shuttle. It would cost you 12$ a day for either uber or lyft. I have used both and also walked the distance after a long day at disney. A 2$ a trip tip isn't gonna kill you but will certainly put a smile on someones face. This is not a 5 star hotel but it meets the needs for an affordable price. Friendly staff, free breakfast, shuttle to disney.
Manager Response: Dear Tonya -  Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property. Summary Heading: Easy access to Disney and nice Rooms
Summary: Nice hotel, nice rooms.  Easy access to Disney and close by.  Not someplace to stay for the pool, it was nice but small.  Rooms are comfortable, and ours was clean and ready for us for an 11pm check in!  I would recommend and would stay again.

Summary Heading: Not within walking distance to the Park
Summary: Place was just comfortable enough for the price. Pool is tiny and in the very center of the parking lot. Staff are friendly but not knowledgeable. We walked past all of the friendly neighbor hotels, which was about 2 km. Then we kept walking for another 2 km along the side of a super busy freeway. Then had to cross it, because the hotel is on the side opposing the side walk. If everything else was booked in the vicinity, I might book this hotel again??

Summary: I'd stay here again on my next Disneyland trip. It was conveniently located by places to eat and shop and literally 3 minutes from Disneyland. Breakfast was nice and organized by the staff very well. It was well worth the price.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest  Thank you for your stay at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property. Summary: Room was humid & really smelly. Incredibly unfriendly staff. I suppose its okay if youre desperate to stay near walking distance of Disneyland, but i dont think its worth it. Cancelled our room within the first 30 minutes. Upon cancellation  the receptionist "Aiden" was extremely rude; talking over / interrupting me. I work in retail, i know to be kind / understanding towards workers, but this was an awful interaction. Ended up staying at a hotel further from Disneyland but much much nicer (& actually cheaper than here!) If youre thinking of staying here, you might want to think again. Its better to get a room in a better hotel & just pay the $20 parking fee at Disneyland. Also, shuttle to Disneyland is not free.
Manager Response: Dear Rochelle  Thank you for your stay at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property. We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are very sorry that you did not have a great stay with us. Please know that yes, the shuttle is free for our guests from our hotel.  We know you have options when it comes to staying in the Disneyland area and we hope you will always stay with us here at the Days Inn.  Please come back soon!  Warmly, The Management

Summary: excellent hotel. Helpful friendly staff. Nothing was too much trouble. We had a 1 bedroom apartment which was a good size with a large balcony. The roof top terrace was just out side. Great for some pease and quite.  Pool was clean as was all the complex.  Lots of activities for kids .  Food in the restaurant was really good with lots of choice for everyone lots of freshly cooked meat and fish.. It was busy at times but was well run with no long waits. Waiter service both in the bar and at the pool side bar was very good. The complex was very pretty and only a five minute walk to the beach and bars although it was on a slope. Harbour area only a 20 min stroll along the promenade. We enjoyed it so much we have already booked again for next year.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was not our choice, we had one of those hotel vouchers with our trip and this was the hotel we were placed at.  Old, dirty, smelled of mold, my skin crawled the whole time their.  Needless to say we didn't spend much time in the room, only to shower quickly and sleep, which wasn't good either.  We made the best out of the situation.  OF course would never choice this place on my own.

Summary: Worth staying here. Walking distance of 15 minutes or less to Disney.  Breakfast was adequate, enough to eat and head out. Pool was decent size just to cool off from the hot sun. Outlet mall was 10 minutes away driving

Summary: Good for those on a budget. Beds very comfortable but pillows just ok. Our room was clean and comfortable. Sink drain very slow but maintenance said that is the way it is supposed to be. They keep stopper low so people don't loose rings. Drains too slow so after brushing teeth or shaving, you have to keep rinsing out sink to get it back to clean.  Walking distance to Disneyland which we ended up doing most the time because shuttle service was not adequate. Shuttle fit only 15 people and every time we used it or tried to, there was way over that amount waiting to ride. Breakfast is ok. I have had better but it is included in hotel rate so one should not complain. Always nice when a hotel offers a free breakfast.  I had issues with washer/dryer. One had difficulty getting coins

If you wanted to walk it's really not that far at all.

Considering we had a first floor, near the street room, we never heard the traffic outside. Close to a few different restaurants too.

Summary: Air conditioner stopped functioning in the middle of our stay. We immediately reported the defect and were dismissed by the staff. After we finally convinced the staff to send a maintenance person to the room he placed his hand in front of the air conditioner that was clearly blowing heated air and reported that it was working as intended. We had experienced the AC working as intended, and it assuredly was not.

Summary: The staff is absolutely horrible. We had stated in our reservation that we would be arriving around 6:30 am. We arrived at 6:40 am. I had to ring it several times before someone acknowledge me and he came with an attitude- I did not catch his name but he drove a red car that he parked in front of the hotel. I explained that we knew we could not officially check in, but that we wanted to park our car because we were going to head to the park. He responded and  I could hardly hear him so I asked him to repeat himself. He stated that we could not park there for another hour- even though there were two open spots. I did not feel like arguing, so we went to eat breakfast and returned. This

Breakfast:  what they call breakfast is a joke.  There was nothing but sugar cereals available and a waffle maker. Nothing else food-wise.    3. Rooms:  the room itself initially presented OK.  Upon further checking, it was clear some things had not been addressed.  First, the towels still had hair in them, the beds had hair in the linens, and the beds themselves were not comfortable. Summary: This hotel is within waking distance to Disney can walk in 15 mins or get a bus right outside that’s one stop away from Disney, and 20 mins in the other direction to Fullerton station where you can get into LA easily enough, the breakfast wasn’t much of anything but ok if you want toast or cereal just something quick until you go out to get food, rooms were spotless and the house keeping worked all day, the pool was small but did the job if we wanted to chill for a few hours there were a few sun beds around it, if I was to go back to Anaheim I would definitely stay here again, you don’t spend enough time at hotels to want anything fancy this was great for what we paid can’t recommend it enough

Summary: My husband and I had a wonderful 9 days in Spain during adult only trip with Adventures By Disney. We enjoyed seeing the wonderful county from Barcelona where we visited Picasso Museum, Park Guelph and La Sagrada Familia, & Pueblo Espanol. Then a flight to Madrid to see the royal palace and armory. In Segovia we saw the summer palace gardens, El Alcazar and Cathedral. We took the bullet train to Cordoba. So much more. Ending at the sea shore of Marbella. So beautiful. Great adventure guides and traveling companions. We recommend for anyone who likes adventure and learning about Spain.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed for a few days, room was clean.  Breakfast is basic carbs.  Front desk staff friendly and helpful. Parking is insufficient.    Pool area a nice spot to relax or have a picnic.  Location is good- right next door is convenience store.  Across street is another, along with a Taco Bell.

Summary Heading: Male Manager feels he has the right to see you in the nude at any time. *Caution for families*
Summary: Don't let the low prices fool you. The hotel is rundown and the staff is both inept and rude. After being embarrassed by a maid who let herself in to the room without a knock or announcing her entrance a conversation with the manager ended with him letting me know that "MANAGEMENT CAN ENTER ROOMS AT ANY TIME THEY PLEASE WITHOUT A KNOCK OR REASON". Please think of your personal comfort and if you are willing to stay at a place that does not care at all about your privacy or your children's privacy. I will gladly pay a few dollars more to ensure the creepy older manager nor any of the rest of his staff will see me nor my family changing again.
Manager Response: Dear Yessica-  Thank you for your stay at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our hotel. Please remember that we had apologized several times for the housekeeper ACCIDENTALLY letting herself in.  When we asked her (the housekeeper) what happened she told us that she had knocked and heard nothing from inside AND it was already past check-out time.  We feel that you became really hostile after we told you that we were not going to give you a free night's stay for this incident - sorry, we do not give free night's stays for accidents.  We know you have options when it comes to accommodations and we hope you always stay at the Days Inn whenever you are in the area.  Please come back soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary Heading: Great value hotel close to Disneyland

Summary: Our stay was April 28-May 2 2018.Great hotel, clean, recently renovated I would think.  Room was perfect.  Kids played in pool, adults in hot tub.  All good. Breakfast good - could use more fruit & more than just one kind of fruit. My only complaint, & I see it seems to be a theme reading these other comments! - was with the Night Clerk "Paul".  Extremely rude & unhelpful to me on 2 occasions during my stay. Looks like we woke him up the AM we were checking out.  It was 5AM - left our room keys in night window as he instructed.  Then I asked for printout of our account. He said it would be emailed, though I wanted a hard copy. I don't think the Days Inn management would be pleased knowing that a person with such a rude arrogant manner is dealing with the guests in this manner.

Summary: Hotel property & room was clean and quite. Staff was very friendly and helpful each time we came across anyone. Location was great about 2 1/2 blocks from Disneyland park. Free shuttle bus available with set times. Breakfast had a variety to choose from, it was lite, simple, healthy food you would most likely eat at home. Cost was reasonable and affordable compared to other hotels near by. Overall we were very satsified with our stay and would highly recommend this hotel .

Summary: If you are doing Disneyland this place is perfect. It is not too big, very safe and very clean, room & bedding looked brand new. Great internet, large counter outside bathroom with sink and tons of space for everyone to get ready. We loved having a little fridge (bigger than a mini-fridge with a small freezer), microwave and coffee maker. Free breakfast was perfect to get us out in the morning with waffles, toast & raisin bread, yogurt, oatmeal and cereals, juice and coffee and bananas. Everything was restocked during the morning. The breakfast attendant was lovely and helpful.  We didn’t plan on using the shuttle since Disney is only a 15 minute walk but we did take it sometimes, Is was very convenient, a 5 minute trip and there was always room when we showed up a few minutes

Summary Heading: Not bad for quick stay - would stay again
Summary: Recently stayed here for a quick overnight trip to Disneyland and was pleasantly surprised!  The front staff was friendly and helpful and check-in was quick.  The room was very spacious and clean, and the bed was one of the more comfortable ones I've experienced in the Anaheim area.  We were towards the back of the unit and it was pretty quiet.  WiFi worked well.  We would have liked the shuttle to run a bit more often, particularly in the afternoon as we wanted to check in and take a break from Disneyland for a bit.  We ended up just taking Lyft and it was a short ride, about $5 I believe. The hotel is a bit tricky to get to coming from the direction of the parks, but it wasn't a super big deal.  The breakfast is the standard breads, cereal, fruit, etc.  I believe they did have

You could take large and small strollers on the shuttle. Very convenient for guests. However, I was told that they could not accommodate a scooter. I explained, mine could be taken apart and asked if it could be placed on rack on back, but I was told it could not be. I either took the ART bus to the park or just rode my scooter over. Did like clean rooms, and convenient location ais a plus.

Summary Heading: FREE ROOM! (If you want to stay with awful management)

But, unfortunately due to medical issues I was forced to cancel our trip. I called Expedia (who I booked through) and gave them the explanation and so they called this hotel AN ENTIRE MONTH PRIOR TO MY STAY to see about canceling our reservation, but after explaining to the front desk my medical issues the management still said No, they would cancel it of course, but I would get absolutely no money back which they make you pay in full at time of reservation. Ridiculous I gave the ample time to find new guests, but they are awful human beings who only care about money. Thankfully, I booked with insurance and
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for choosing the Days Inn as a place to stay while in the Disneyland area.  We know that you have cnoices in lodging and we hope that you always stay here with us whenever you are in the area.  We are so sorry that you were not able to stay here due to your medical issue.   However, Expedia was NOT contacted as you claimed they were a month in advance.  Had they been contacted, the reservation would have been deleted from our bookings automatically and you would not have had to call.  Since there was a reservation for you still in our system, there was no cancellation that we knew about.    We are sorry that you became ill, but if you have an issue with paying for the room, please contact Expedia since they are the ones that collected the money.  Please call our Ziaul, the manager if you need to discuss anything else.  Sincererly, The  Front Desk

We were told parking was guaranteed, but since there was no open spots, we would have to park in an illegal spot and move the car by 7am, even though it was 12:30am. He threated us by saying “if we did not move it, something bad would happen”. Summary Heading: Not great even for a 2 star
Summary: Pros: close to Disney, 15 minute walk. Can't hear freeway   Cons: messed up reservation when dates were changed (cancelled us and had to rebook once we were there checking in- could have been very catastrophic as all other hotels were full), paper thin walls, you can hear the people behind you. If upstairs room people start showering you WILL hear the pipes going (don't freak out, no one is trying to get into your room), bathroom tub chipped all over the bottom, looks very old. Dead insects inside the lights (to be expected but not that much)  overall: stayed here for the free breakfast, turned out to be very very basic (we're not picky on breakfast either but all that was there was cereal, waffles, and toast.)   would stay here again based solely on price and competitor

Ice machine and snack machine are outside. All rooms open to the outside, but I never felt noise or security was a problem. Beds were comfortable and room was reasonably clean. Room was of good size for up to 4 people. Checkin/Checkout was fast and easy.

This is not a corporate hotel it's a personal owned with the name. Read the fine print and be careful. Don't ask for extra pillows for fear of being spoken to in a forien language.  The only thing hot for breakfast is the waffle maker. Check in was atrocious, the room was average, and the breakfast was non existent. However, the attitude of the front desk staff was by far the worst part of this stay. I am in front office management at a Four-Diamond international brand, and I would terminate every single one of your front desk agents for poor attitude, unprofessional appearance, and unfortunate indifference to the concerns of the guest. I will be paying the extra $200+ per night going forward to stay on-property with Disney because of this stay. Absolutely a bare-bones

There is a fridge and a microwave, plus a limited continental breakfast. The beds are super comfy and there wasn’t anything that stuck out to me as unusual in the room. The hotel has a shuttle which is also in my cons list.  Cons: The hotel is about a 15 minute walk over an overpass to the parks. Pool was ice cold yet it had been above 90 outside for more than a week, would be nice if they heated it.  Breakfast is very poor, bread, cereal, a staff member making waffles but they were raw.  Only banana's for fruit and 2 or 3 yogurts in the fridge every morning (we were a family of 4 so never enough for all of us) so we started eating elsewhere after a couple of days. Summary: I needed a last minute stay by Disneyland and didnt want to pay an astronomical price. you know what they say: you get what you pay for. Its okay for the price. At least the room was clean. What was weird is that they dont have a shower or tub, just a hole in the floor and the toilet is next to it. So if someone took a shower and you need to use a restroom, you literally have to sit ankles dip in water. Also, there are no door to separate a closet and restroom so if someone using a restroom, you cant get into the closet. Very weird set up.  Air conditioner was bad. It either super cold or super hot. Lastly, the breakfast was by far the worst I ever got in a similar hotel. Just some bread, cereal and cold milk.  It was okay to sleep for one night. At least its close to
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property. When I tried to telephone back to the hotel to let the manager know the person at the desk would not let me speak to the manager because I would not give her my room number (which I chose not to give since I did not want to receive any other problems with the hotel staff in retaliation) with her being so defensive of the driver. After having driven in from out of state, the last thing I wanted to do was to leave my car next door and carry my bags from there to my room. It is my guess that the person at the desk was not parked next door (there were no other cars parked there). I stayed in this room for less than 10 hours, and I will likely not be back. Summary: I have been planning this trip for a few months for an annaversary surprise. We arrived on Jan. 11th, 2018 and we were supposed to stay until Jan. 14th, 2018. When we arrived, the man at the counter was very rude and seemed to not be focused on us at all. We asked questions and we talked over us and completely dismissed us. We went up to the hotel and slept horribly on the beds and when we woke up our second night, I noticed something crawling on me. I turned on the lights and there was a huge line of ants coming out of the wall from the closet (We were on the second floor). They found our food that we brought for the trip and we had to throw away most of it! We called the front desk and the person at the desk told us that they could not do anything untill the manager came at 7
Manager Response: Dear Rachel -   Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so sorry you did not have a great experience here.  Southern California is known to have an ant problem and we keep an exterminator on call for this reason, however they come during normal working hours.  Our front desk clerk did offer you a room change, which you accepted.  We are sorry that it wasn't as timely as you wanted it to be, but at that hour we are not staffed to be able to switch rooms quickly.  We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging and we hope that you always choose the Travelodge whenever you are in the area.  Please come back soon!!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: We planned a last minute trip to Disney Land and there weren't a lot of hotels that were within close walking distance available.  This property offered a fairly close location, free wi-fi, free parking and breakfast included which were all things I was looking for.  The room was clean and a little more spacious than some hotel rooms.  The beds were comfortable.  My only complaint would be that they claim to have a free shuttle to Disney Land but unfortunately it doesn't run very often.  The first one leaves at 7:40am from the hotel and that is way too late.  If you want to be in the park by 8:00 am you need to start earlier than that to get through security and then the line to the park.  The shuttle needs to start earlier and run more frequently.

Summary: My family reserved our room way in advance as we knew were were heading to Disneyland for Christmas.  On the website it said the hotel was in the middle of a remodel. Carpet in the room had a gap near the bathroom that was a little hard on bare feet but nothing major.  As for walking distance it is 1/2 mile from the front gates to Disney.  My family walked it in 15 minutes and you do have to walk over I-5, but I never felt like it was a dangerous walk.  The hotel has a shuttle but the times are not

Summary: We had a good stay at the Days Inn. It was close to Disneyland and the shuttle they offered was helpful and right on time. Breakfast was good. Basic breakfast of toast, yogurt, waffles, cereal, coffee and juice. The staff was nice. We checked in with Sonny and she was very nice and helpful. Only complaint would be the cost of a late check out. Check out is at 11am and our flight wasn’t until 7:30pm so we inquired about paying a fee to check out a little later. The fee to extend the check out to 3pm is $75 which is a little high considering that’s more than half the cost for one whole night so we just check out on time and found our own entertainment until our flight home. I would also recommend more tables during breakfast. One morning we were waiting for about 15 minutes for a

Summary: We've stayed at this hotel twice this year and plan on it being our future stay every time we visit Anaheim. We go to Disneyland about 6-7 times a year and it's just easier to get a hotel for the night with a young kid. We've stayed at about 7 cheaper end properties around the park and this has been the best by far. Super, super friendly staff. The rooms are very clean (which cannot be said for other hotels in the area). The beds are super comfortable. Even though the hotel is on a major road, it's very quiet in terms of street noise. The shuttle to and from the park is a really nice bonus even though you can walk (about 15 minutes). Continental breakfast included with a lovely woman making waffles, cereal, coffee, juice, toast, and yogurt. We will definitely be back!

Free breakfast mainly cereal but can also make your own waffle or toast.  Only issue was cable tv was broken in 1st room assign and when transferred tv still broken in that room too until fixed later.

Summary Heading: This hotel was fine for the price. We were concerned that...
Summary: This hotel was fine for the price. We were concerned that the chain lock on the door was broken. We had to keep the stroller in front of the door so our little one couldn’t escape. We also had to walk back each night because of the odd evening hours of the shuttle. The room was quite and we all slept fine. I can’t say that we will stay here again but you get what you pay for.

Summary: This was a good room for the price considering the proximity to Disneyland.  The room was very spacious as was the bathroom vanity area.  The bed & pillows were very comfortable.  Breakfast was nothing special (Waffles, cereal, toast, yogurt, fruit, juice) but it was nice to not have to worry about where to get breakfast before heading out for the day.  Staff was friendly & helpful & check in/out was fast & easy.  Room came with a mini-fridge which was nice to be able to store drinks & snacks.  Free shuttle to Disneyland was very convenient as parking at Disneyland is atrocious.  Area was fairly quiet.  Only cons was that parking spaces were limited & tight & free wifi was slow & cut out a lot.
Manager Response: Dear Celia  Thank you for staying at the Days Inn and for taking the time to review our property. Summary Heading: So good I don't want to share
Summary: The last time I gave this great of a review for a SoCal motel I regretted it because they raised their rates. Sure, you could pay less at other places in the area but you'll also get a lot less. Parking? $20 at Disney. Free shuttle at hotel. Breakfast? You could pay and be bloated for rides or eat something small for free and get lunch in the park. Jacuzzi = plus. Great customer service, check. The rooms are recently renovated. They do limit only one car in the lot per room, so beware of that.

Summary Heading: Large rooms, great access to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed in the deluxe room with two beds and a sofa bed.  It comfortably fit our group of 3 adults and 3 young children.  Being right across the street from the main entrance was perfect for coming back for midday toddler naps.  Breakfast was very basic and nothing to write home about, but it did the job.  For the price, I would stay here again.  Clean, convenient, and decently priced.

Summary: Days Inn & Suites Anaheim is a great place to stay if you are planning on visiting the Disney parks and don't plan on spending a lot of time in your room. The rooms are a nice size, clean and updated. Perfect for somewhere to lay your tired head after a fun filled day!! Our only complaint would be the shuttle service to and from the park. They have a very small shuttle so it takes 2 or 3 trips to get everyone transported. And the shuttle times are not good if you plan on being at Disneyland before the gates open and if you're like our family, we close the park down at night after the shuttle makes it last run so we have to get a lyft.  We will absolutely stay there again. The staff is nice and willing to make your stay a welcome one.

Would highly recommend this to everyone from singles to small families!

In the second room, after I finally got the door open, the door alarm would not stop beeping. The staff claimed that all the doors do that. I went to close the curtain, and the bracket fell off the wall. The staff sent someone to look at it but of course could not do anything at that time. The following morning the shuttle driver was rude. This hotel has a shuttle but it only drops off and picks up at certain times of the day and night. Not a consistent scedule. However, the front desk staff were very  nice.

Summary Heading: You Get What You Pay For...
Summary: I will start of by saying, Yes, this Hotel is close to the Park. We were room 136. We liked the price of the Hotel, and not having to pay for parking. BUT you do get what you pay for. They did offer a free shuttle however, I wouldn't call it a shuttle, it’s more of a large van that seats 14 guest (15 if you include the driver). The Shuttle times were NOT convenient, for us anyways. It would leave at 7:40am when the parks opened at 8am, and if you are like us we like to get there earlier than that to avoid the long lines of getting in. It would only come every 30 minutes when it was after 8pm. So, we had to Lyft most of the time ($5.80 to/from parks). We didn't try the breakfast. The Wifi was not good at all... Our room was meh, the shower was clean and the bathroom floors. The

Had problems with our room key not working a few times, and the WiFi was absolutely terrible. Guests were screaming and banging on the walls, and at one point I walked outside my room to watch the Disneyland fireworks and there was a guest standing outside my door hanging out in nothing but his underwear.  Overall, it was comfy and I would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Terrible! First and last - Would never book again
Summary: This hotel was awful! We booked this hotel through Hotels.com for 4 adults (2 separate couples) and it said it had free parking with no other details on their own website or Hotels.com. We arrived to check in with 2 vehicles as each couple drove separately from different areas. They had a typed-up letter taped on their entrance and check-in counter that said only 1 vehicle per room "during busy times." It was never advertised that they only allowed 1 vehicle per room on the hotel's actual website or Hotels.com as we viewed the room on both before booking. They absolutely would not allow us to park 2 cars (one that required ADA handicapped parking) even though there was many open parking spots at 8pm at night checking in on a Wednesday. The hotel staff did absolutely nothing to

Summary Heading: We loved this place… until the shuttle didn't show....
Summary: You will see from this ratings my wife and I loved this hotel.... until the return shuttle didn't show at Disneyland (DL). The schedule given at check-in states the shuttle arrives at DL every hour on the half-hour until 30 minutes after closing. On Thursday, September 28th, DL closed at 10pm. We arrived in time for the shuttle, but no shuttle. When I called the hotel I  was told that the shuttle stopped running at 9:30, even though the park closed at 10pm because the schedule they had listed 9pm. They do not check the DL website to verify hours.  When we arrived at the hotel (after finding a taxi), we spoke with the counter person. She showed no sympathy, stating that was the way it was with their shuttle service, despite the fact that the park was open late. The attitude she

We will revisit our shuttle schedule and see if there is anything we could do to circumvent this issue should it arise again.   Thank you for bringing them to our attention. Summary Heading: Me and my boyfriend decided to plan a trip to Disneyland...
Summary: Me and my boyfriend decided to plan a trip to Disneyland, so we decided to choose a place that had free breakfast, a shuttle to Disneyland, and internet. Honestly, everything was pretty good, but the internet never worked the five days we stayed there. The breakfast and shuttle were decent, but we hoped there would be a little bit better selection for breakfast and shuttle times. As for the staff, the guy at the front desk was rude and uninviting, but the cleaning crew and shuttle drivers did a good job and were friendly. Overall, it wasn’t the best, but it wasn’t the worst either.

The free shuttle service to Disneyland and continental breakfast were added bonuses as well as a  perfect view of the fireworks from the hotel which wasn't mentioned.  The breakfast options were pretty limited but better than nothing!  20 min walk to Disneyland or 5 min bus ride.  I would recommend this for the budget conscious family without sacrificing quality.
