Summary: Great location to disney. We walked and pushed the stroller with two young kids.  It took us only 10 minutes.  The rooms were old and needs updating but the room were clean.  The service was great and the pool was nice for the kids.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Where do I start? The wireless Internet did not work. The carpet was disgustingly sticky. The microwave is state-of-the-art 1970's technology and the timer didn't work. Water pressure was decent but the A/C was a little loud. Someone's name was scratched into the back of the bathroom door. The shower curtain had seen better days and was sewn. The remote control range is very limited to the old CRT TV.   On the brighter side,  Complimentary shuttle & customer service saves this hotel from a 1 rating. The shuttle drivers were awesome.  Parking space was adequate for our full size pickup, and location is about five min away from Disney.   I would absolutely never stay here again and I recommend that people search for another place to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beware: Don’t be TRICKED by the Deceptive Ad
Summary: Just want to add my Two Cents.  This Days Inns near Disneyland is just plain Nasty. My family stayed here the second week in June 2011.  This Days Inn is just plain AWFUL. The manager is RUDE and Unfriendly.  He did not care about the deplorable conditions of our room.       Many of the so called amenities were BROKEN and did not work.  The Air Conditioner was loud and noisy. It made the room smell worse- we resorted to leaving the door open. The room definitely needed a Good Cleaning or should I say Upgrading. The Dresser was broken; the Bedspread was Faded and Worn Out- and rather Smelly;   The Tub took forever to drain and filled up even when we were TAKING showeris.  My oldest child could not stand under the shower – it was way too low – only about 5 feet from the ground.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotels rooms are Terrible,  it smells like mold!  I hated being in the room due to the smell.  Strangely the shower head was so low i couldn't wash my hair and I am 5'2! The shuttle is too small to accommodate the amount of people waiting for it! The stairs to get to the rooms were not stable. The manager was very rude to me and my family.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay, Would definately stay again!
Summary: We stayed here from 6/5/2011 to 6/11/2011.  Our stay at this hotel was wonderful from the mimute we arrived. I was so nervous after reading the reviews here but found for a budget hotel this was perfect.  the hotel is older but the rooms were clean and cleaned everyday.  The beds were comfortable and the micorwave and firdge was a huge plus and saved lots of $$$.  The bathrooms are dated but to shower who can compliance as there were no bugs and the hot water never went out. Breakfast was simple but served it purpose and they always made sure it was restocked. The shuttle was a little to crowded but I have teenagers so walking was not an issue and it only took maybe 10 minutes.  The pool was the best where my kids loved to spend the time.  by the way you can see the fireworks
Manager Response: none

Summary: We only stayed at Days Inn for one night but even that one day was great.  The service and hospitality was great.  I originally reserved a best western motel because  I thought  the stay would be great, knowing that they did not have a shuttle.  But after discussing with my husband about the amenities/benefits of staying there, with the cost and all, it did not offer shuttle service.  So I looked around, just seeing if there were any other motels that gave discounts for AAA members, since this was my first time using my AAA card for this type of service.  I came across Days Inn on Harbor and Ball, right down the street from Disneyland.  And guess what, not only was the price reasonable but they also had shuttle service.  I canceled my reservation with Best Western and made
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place is awesome, I have to admit i was a little leary after reading some of the reviews, but the service, price and rooms were all exceptional.  For an inexpensive hotel this place was great.  The kids loved the pool, it was super close to Disney land (we walked a couple of times with 5 kids ranging from 5 to 12) no complaints about the free breakfast (remember this is an inexpensive hotel).  The staff was super friendly, giving us free limes from their own fruit for our Corona, and giving us a ride to the park after we missed the shuttle.  Anything you wanted to know the guy at the front desk was able to find for us.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was clean and nice (except for really hard mattress).  However,the ramp for wheelchair access is next to the houskeeping supply room.  This area was always blocked with carts, mop pails ang garbage.  Bugs anf flying insects ruled this area.  It was truly disgusting having to pass through this area to get to my room.  I always had to yell for someone to clear the walkway so that I could pass through. This hotel offers a free continental breakfast, but not if you're in a wheelchair.  The breakfast is offered on the second floor and stairs are the only access.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very well done on everything The clerk that handled us, Parveen, was very courteous and went beyond that in helping us  have a great stay  Please thank him for us, that's equal to 4 attaboys!
Manager Response: none

Summary: When we first arrived we thought we were on a winner, the guy at the counter was so helpful. We got to the hotel about 1pm, were exhausted from 20 hours flying, he saw us and booked us in straight away. From there not so good.  The fireworks that woke us about 9.30pm as they exploded directly over the hotel weren't their fault, they were Disney's. However, they should warn people they're on the way.   Over 9 nights we were left without towels three times by room service. As was the pool on the two occasions we went there. The office delivered them quickly after you rang, but you shouldn't have to ring. The rooms were average but for the price ok.   Located in a good area for cheap food including 'Shakey's' next door.
Manager Response: none

Summary: the room served it's purpose, but there wasn't any extra effort put forth to make it extra special.  for example, the continental breakfast was very basic, nothing very special. coffee not yummy.  the pool was nice and warm, but we had to walk to the front office to request towels EVERYTIME we went.  they never had available towels at the pool. the shuttle service to disneyland was not accommodating to guests.  the drivers were very kind and helpful, but the front desk staff was not.  there was one woman in particular that was exceptionally rude at the front desk.  lastly, there was minimal parking.  since we took our van, because of the inconvenience of the shuttle, 3 of the 4 nights we stayed, we had to park in a no parking zone.  concerning to us, even though the staff agreed
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pros: 1) Closer to disneyland (around 0.8 miles) 2) Shuttle drop to disneyland (1 shuttle / hour) 3) Suffecient parking. 4) Microwave and refrigerator in room.  Cons: 1) Tons of stains on carpet. Looks like carpet was not changed for years. 2) Breakfast is a joke. You can call it free stale donuts. You will find couple of donuts, 1 white bread packet some cereals. Try to find a good breakfast place.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: i enjoyed my stay and will stay here again
Summary: This place was affordable, clean, and close to the parks. Great to have a free shuttle to the parks. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. Beds were a little uncomfortable but overall good place for the budget traveler. Thumbs up!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked a Non-smoking room through Expedia, and when I checked in they gave me a smoking room.  I indicated to the hotel staff person that I didn’t book a smoking room, and they said that was the information they got from Expedia and that I must have booked it.  I said I wouldn’t because my son would have a hard time breathing in a smoking room.  He gave me a smoking room anyway because “the computer will not let me change it” and said just try it, and if it smells we will have housekeeping spray air freshener in the room.  I tried it, it smelled, and I went back with my itinerary print out from Expedia that said “NON-Smoking” room.  He said he was full and didn’t have any non-smoking rooms… I said it is just after 3:00 check-in time, how can you not have any rooms open? He
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Dirty,No towels, bad attitude at front desk! And a leaky plumbing problem in bathroom sink!!
Summary: I would never stay there again. I just in the shower and didn't realize there weren't any towels, then I brushed my teeth and the sink starts leaking from the faucet, then I look fir a blow dryer and my room doesn't have one, then I lay down to rest and there are french fries beside the bed on the floor! I would never stay there again and the front desk clerk said if we wanted to check in one hour early at 200 we would have to pay another 50 dollars!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was surprised to learn upon arrival that the Days Inn would drop me (complimentary shuttle service) off at the Convention Center right after a drop at DisneyLand, so that little "gift" was a very welcome thank you instead of having to make taxi or other public transportation services.   Also that gal that worked Sat. 3/12 in the continental breakfast room was super nice, just a very hard worker you could tell, as were the drivers of the shuttle service-SUPER DUPER NICE!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Value for the Budget-Conscious Traveler
Summary: I greatly enjoyed staying at the Days Inn Anaheim. There was a shuttle to and from Disneyland that left and picked up at all times of the day. The free breakfast "snack" was pretty good for a budget hotel. The room was pretty clean. Perhaps the carpets could be vaccuumed a bit more thoroughly but everything else was spotless. This was a perfect hotel is you are visiting Disneyland. There are a lot of kids running around outside as they are getting ready to leave to Disneyland in the morning so if you are a light sleeper you might not like it but we didn't mind.
Manager Response: none

Summary: me and my boyfriend had an amazing and relaxing weekend at this hotel my only complain is that i wish we would have been able to take our breakfast back to our room instead of having to eat it in the breakfast room. but overall great and quiet location and close to everything in anaheim!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your great comments regarding your recent stay at our hotel. We are very pleased that you had a great time with us and that you enjoyed your Disneyland getaway. It is our pleasure to see that our amenities and facilities met your expectations and that our comfortable accommodations provided a relaxing setting for your stay. Thank you again, and we look forward to being your hosts on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay while visiting Disneyland on a budget!
Summary: We stayed 4 nights while visiting Disneyland and California Adventure.  Our room was clean and the beds were very comfortable.  We felt very secure and their FREE shuttle service was always on time and very dependable.  The complementary breakfast was very fresh and we enjoyed it too.  Their staff was very helpful and courtious!  Loved our stay, great price excellent service.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review on your recent stay at our Days Inn near Disneyland. We are happy to see that you enjoyed your time here and that all our amenities and services were up to your expectations. Our staff and management work continuously to ensure that our accommodations and facilities are of great quality and that our guests get the most value for their money. It will be our pleasure to see you back on your next visit to the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Convenient, clean place for families going to Disneyland.
Summary: This is our second stay, we like it because it is clean, good location, well organized & the complimentary continental breakfast is good.  When you check in they give you the shuttle times (which ran exactly as posted). The staff are friendly & helpful.  We will stay again.
Manager Response: We are very glad you enjoyed your time at our hotel, and that you continue to use us as your preferred hotel in the Disneyland area. As always, our goal is to ensure that all our guests have a great time and leave feeling that our accommodations were of great value to them.  Your comments help us improve our service, and let us know where we are doing great to continue delivering that quality of service. We look forward to seeing you again on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: The staff was very friendly & the shuttle to Disneyland was convenient.  However, the room was very dirty for my standards.  The floor was filthy, the sink was very outdated making it look dirty.  One bed was bent so one side was lopsided.  The shower head had a leak causing water to spray the entire bathroom floor.  As far as the courtesy breakfast...Toast had the texture of styrofoam, the donuts tasted & felt like they were 3 days old & there was no ice available in the eating room.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review of our hotel. We appreciate every comment you have about your stay with us as it helps us to improve the quality of our service and accommodations.  We apologize that our hotel was not up to your standards during your recent stay. It is our goal to improve continuously and will take your comments to make the appropriate corrections. We hope that you were still able to enjoy your time in Disneyland while staying with us and that you will continue to visit Anaheim in the future.

Summary: The service was good, carpet in the room was dirty but not too bad.  And why in the world the receptionist gave us a 2nd floor room, while there are tons of empty ones in the first floor?  We had a lot of luggage.  And why the heck the receptionist told me to use stairs all the way cross the front yard, while there is one right beside the office?  Is he stupid?  The rest of the clerks there are very helpful and nice.  Breakfast is good, free internet access is fast enough.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments regarding your stay at our hotel. We are glad that our accommodations were up to your standards and you were able to enjoy your time in Disneyland.  We apologize for the inconvenience of assigning you a second floor room during your stay. It is our goal to ensure that all our guests leave satisfied with our hotel, and look forward to coming back. As part of our commitment, we take your comments seriously and will make sure that all our employees are trained appropriately to avoid causing inconveniences such as in your case. Please know that we work constantly to improve ourselves and the quality of our service. It will be our pleasure to be your gracious hosts again and to have the opportunity of providing you with our improved service during your next trip to Disneyland.

Summary: Well, first off I will say that the front desk staff was very nice.  The general customer service was good.  I even left my $400 iPhone in the front office by mistake and the guy kept it in a drawer until I figured it out and came back for it.  I like honesty : )    I wouldn't say the room was very clean.  The ironing board looked AWFUL.  Had a lot of stains.  Each morning we woke up there (four mornings) there was a sheet of water on our bathroom floor and you could tell the corners of the bathroom had been rotting for some time.  In other words they've known for a while that there's a leak somewhere and have yet to fix it.  The maintenance at this hotel is obviously lacking and the rooms are in huge need of updating.  We had a non-smoking room yet could smell smoke residue in
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your words on your experience at our hotel. We do our best to provide all our guests with comfortable accommodations. We are disappointed that we were not able to provide you with a comfortable experience during your stay. Please accept our apologies for the inconveniences we created with the things that we fell short on. It is our goal to provide clean, enjoyable accommodations to all our guests, and we are disappointed that we did not perform our job as we should have.  We are glad that you appreciated our friendly staff, since it is our commitment to ensure that every guest experiences warm, welcoming service.  We would like to invite you to give us a try again on your next trip to Anaheim so we can have a chance to make it up to you by providing you with the high standards of service which we are known for.

Summary: Good for a couple of nights stay. Walking distance to disneyland and restaurants.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We ended up staying here because we arrived early on the Saturday of the long weekend and our reservation at the Ho Jo did not start until Sunday.  We ended up payine $30 more for than the nights at the Ho Jo.    Our room was filthy.  We had to keep our shoes on whenever our feet were on the floor. If you looked where the carpet met the wall there was one big line of dirt. The carpet had a huge burn between the beds.  It looked like some one had left the iron there a few years ago and it has been peeling away ever since.   Chunks of the bath mat were falling off as you were drying to clean the filth off.  I didn't see any bugs so if it is the only available hotel in town and you don't mind paying top dollar for a dump, make a reservation here.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know of your recent experience at our hotel. I apologize deeply for any inconveniences that you experienced with us. Let it be known that your opinion counts and the appropriate steps have been taken to prevent anything like this happening again. The quality of our service is of the utmost importance to us - as you can see from all other reviews - and we work diligently to maintain our high standards by recruiting and training the right people for the job.  I would like to extend you an invitation to stay with us again and experience the warm, personable service which we are known for. Please contact me directly should you choose to stay with us again, or if you have any questions or concerns.

Summary Heading: Nothing fancy but a clean place & good value
Summary: Recently spent a Friday & Saturday night at this hotel w/my 15-yr-old son & 11-yr-old daughter. I got a great rate of $65 per night on a regular room w/two queen beds. The room came with a working coffee maker, microwave & refrigerator. The shower had plenty of hot water & great water pressure (which I really needed after the long days at Disneyland). It had free parking, free wifi, free breakfast (continental type) & a free shuttle to Disneyland running basically every hour. I love staying at fancy hotels when I can. It's part of the whole vacation experience. But for this trip, I knew I wanted to spend the majority of my money on Disneyland. I also knew we would not be at the hotel much. This hotel fit the bill well. Was this place fancy? No, not a bit. Did I want for
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to tell us about your experience with us. We take your comments as our guide towards improving our service. We are glad to hear that our hotel was a good value, and that it allowed you to enjoy Disneyland more thoroughly.    We will be delighted to be your gracious hosts again on your next trip to the Disneyland area.

Summary: Rooms were spacious and clean. Close to Disney within walking distance. Parking was a little tight.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments regarding your stay at our hotel. We are glad to hear that you found value and convenience in the facilities and amenities we provide. Our staff and management are happy to hear that we were able to provide you with helpful and courteous service.   Please come visit us again soon. We will be delighted to be your gracious hosts again on your next trip to the Disneyland area.

Summary: Everyone was friendly.Sabrina was extremely pleasant and very helpful with all our needs.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your opinion about your stay with us. It is a great pleasure to hear that our service was courteous and welcoming. Our goal is to ensure that every guest that stays at our hotel is as pleasantly surprised by our friendliness as you.   It is our reward to hear that we were able to contribute to a happy Disneyland experience. We look forward to seeing you again on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: Days Inn Suites are located very conveniently exactly 10 min by foot to Disneyland. It's much better option then to park your vehicle at the designated Disney parking, then take the buss and arrive at Disney.   A simple brief walk spares you all the trouble. Rooms are spacey. Not fancy but good for children as it allows them to roam.  All appliances are operable and the personnel is friendly and efficient.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know how much you enjoyed your stay at our hotel. We are glad to hear that we lived up to your expectations - as it is our goal to ensure that all our guests leave satisfied. Please come and visit us soon. Our entire staff is ready to make your next trip to Disneyland your best vacation yet.

Summary: i found this hotel online not sure what I was getting into. The location was great. You just walk over the overpass and you are at Disneyland (10 minute walk if that). If you don't want to walk, they have a free shutle to Disneyland that runs pretty much every hour. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. i would recommend this hotel and plan on staying there again.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your gracious review. Our staff and management take pride in knowing that we were able to make your Disneyland vacation a pleasant experience. Our commitment is to provide each and every guest with our own brand of warm, positive service.  We are happy that you were able to enjoy our convenient location, our facilities and amenities,  and that they were a great value for you. Please come back and visit us again soon. It will be our pleasure to make your next trip to Anaheim a memorable one.

Summary Heading: If you want quiet and quality, go elsewhere
Summary: We wanted a hotel close to Disneyland for an average price.  We got that but thats about it.  The grounds were pretty but pool was dirty and hot tub cold.  The beds were hard, the carpet dirty and the breakfast was minimal.  There were lots of kids running around at all hours, and also unsupervised in the breakfast area which was very unacceptable to me.  Kids putting there dirty hands into the food! YUK  We will spend a little more and go to a better hotel next time.  This was our first trip to Anaheim so we didn't know where to start.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your words on your experience at our hotel. We do our best to provide all our guests with comfortable accommodations. Being in the Disneyland area, we cater to a lot of families on a daily basis and that does create a level of noise at certain times of the day. We are disappointed that we were not able to provide you with a quiet, restful atmosphere.  We are making efforts to ensure that children are  not left unsupervised at the breakfast area and throughout the hotel. Being that every family is a unique situation, this will be an ongoing task at our hotel.  Hopefully your overall Disneyland experience was still an enjoyable one despite our shortcomings. We would like to invite you to give us a try again on your next trip to Anaheim so we can have a chance to make it up to you by providing you with the high standards of service which we are known for.

Summary Heading: It is not walking distance to Disney
Summary: I had called in advance and asked if it was walking distance to Disney, the answer should have been NO but I was told it was down the street (it was and over the highway etc).  Beds were comfortable and it is a decent hotel.  Not what we were hoping for but ok!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments regarding your stay at our hotel. We take every review seriously and use it as an opportunity to improve from them. Please accept our apologies regarding our mistake in quoting you the distance to Disneyland. We will train all our front desk employees to ensure that we provide all our guests with a realistic estimate of walking time and distance to the park.    We are glad to hear that you found our rooms and beds to be comfortable, and that your experience with us was not altogether disagreeable.  Once again, we apologize for the inconvenience we caused. We hope that you will remember your Disneyland vacation as a pleasant one in spite of our mistake. It would be an honor to have you back again so we can have a chance to make it up to you, and to provide you with the exceptional service we strive for every day.

Summary: We stayed here with no clue what we were getting into.  The staff was very helpful with finding us shuttle to Universal Studios, Sea World, and the airport.  The rooms were very clean, spacious, and the beds were quite comfortable.  Breakfast was not as deluxe as we were hoping for, but nonetheless was good enough.  There were 3 female adults and a 3-year-old staying in our room and the cupboard space for getting ready in the morning was perfect.  My only complaint was that the hot tub was quite dirty.  The complimentary shuttle that brought us to Disneyland left at really good times and was quite accommodating.  There were a couple times that we walked to Disneyland and it was only a 15 minute walk so it wasn't bad at all!  For the price we were more than happy with this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind words. Our staff and management take pride in knowing that we were able to make your Disneyland vacation a pleasant experience. Our commitment is to provide each and every guest with our own brand of warm, positive service.  We are happy that you were able to enjoy our complimentary shuttle as well as our other amenities and facilities, and that they were a great value for you. Please come back and visit us again soon. It will be our pleasure to make your next trip to Anaheim a memorable one.

Summary: This is a no frills property, rooms are outdated and a little rundown but yet rooms are very clean. Hotel has a shuttle that runs between Hotel and Maingate Disney which was a nice bonus even though Disney is fairly close. Front Desk Staff are very helpful and kind. I would recommend this if you are not looking at spending a lot of time in the room.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments regarding your experience at our hotel. It is from comments such as yours that we can determine the direction of our services to ensure that all our guests are satisfied. We are glad to hear that you found value and convenience in the facilities and amenities we provide. Our staff and management are happy to hear that we were able to provide you with helpful and courteous service.   Please come visit us again soon. We will be delighted to be your gracious hosts again on your next trip to the Disneyland area.

Summary: Not to far from Disney, parking area is small, but manageable.  Decent choices for breakfast, staff on hand to keep items out during the disney groups rush.  Has wireless internet, but very slow connection.  Rooms well kept, whole area was clean.  Be warned though, when Disney does the fireworks display at nite, they are right over the hotel, can get a little loud.  :-)
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review.  It's a pleasure to hear that your stay with us was enjoyable, and that our rooms were clean and comfortable. We hope that we were able to contribute towards making your Disneyland vacation a success.   Please know that we take your comments into consideration. We have addressed the issue with our wireless internet to ensure that it will no longer be an inconvenience.   Once again, we are very grateful for your review, and we look forward to seeing you again on your next trip to Disneyland.

Summary: Our visit was just great.  Only downfall was that our room was not available when we arrived after 3:30.  They were still cleaning our room, but we were in by 4:00.  The room was fine and the breakfast was better than expected.  We will return again for sure.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your opinion about your stay with us. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed our clean rooms and our complimentary breakfast. Our goal is to provide clean, comfortable accommodations for a great value to all our guests. We work constantly to improve the quality of our product and services, and to ensure that every experience with us is warm and enjoyable. We look forward to seeing you again on your next trip to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: conveniently located to disney attractions with a free shuttle service
Summary: It is well located for disneyland attractions with a free shuttle service. Adequate for a short stay to have a night's rest after spending the day at disney.  On the downside there is nothing close within walking distance other than a Pizza restuarant . The front desk staff are very unhelpful and totally disconnected.  the breakfast , room, amenities and cleanliness is average and you get what you pay for
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments regarding your stay at our hotel. Feedback from our customers helps us to ensure that we are keeping up with our service standards. It is a pleasure to hear that our accommodations and amenities were of value to you.  We apologize that our front desk staff did not live up to our service promise. We will take your comment into consideration as we work to improve our staff training and assessment. We hope that you enjoyed your Disneyland vacation, and that we were able to contribute positively to your experience.

Summary: My friends and I were booked into this hotel for 2 nights upon our arrival into Los Angeles.  The friend who booked it lives nearby so this was a good base location.  Two rooms were booked and both were very clean and spacious.  A member of our party used the pool and found it to be clean and of adequate size.   Breakfast was included and was fine (as described in other reviews) - all self service but more than adequate.  The staff ensured there was plenty to eat/drink and the breakfast room was very clean. The location of the hotel is excellent for Disneyland (although not the purpose of our stay) and you can see (and hear) the nightly fireworks perfectly. The hotel was everything it should have been - clean, convenient and close to attractions.  It made a great base for myself
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind words. Our staff and management are pleased in knowing that we were able to make your trip to Anaheim a pleasant experience. We are committed to provide all off our guests with our own brand of warm, positive service.  We are glad that you enjoyed our clean rooms, pleasant pool, ample Breakfast, and excellent location. The fact that our facilities were a great value for you lets us know that we are doing our job well. Please come back and visit us again soon. It will be our pleasure to make your next trip to Anaheim a memorable one.

Summary: We stayed here for three nights with our two young boys (6 & 8), I chose this hotel because they had a free shuttle to Disney, free parking, free breakfast, microwave and a fridge. It is a bit run down but we were not staying there for the room. The shuttle was actually like a 13 passanger van..but it got us there and back. I reccomend getting to the shuttle (in front of the lobby) 15-20 minutes early!!  We did walk back to the hotel once which took us aprox. 10 minutes...not bad. Like I said is a bit run down but with the money we saved we got to spend at Disneyland instead. The fridge and miocrowave is a plus if you dont want to keep spending your money to eat at Disney. There are quite a few resturants nearby too!  All in all I would reccomend this hotel if your staying a few
Manager Response: none

Summary: we stayed for 4 nights. 20 min walk from disney, but they run free shuttle to and from disneyland. Alot of hotels charge $4/person one way.  Breakfast was aright considering nobody eat too much before rides. Pool opens up at 10am which is late. I will stay again in this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The old saying, "you get what you paid for". we did not get what we paid for!!!
Summary: Over the years of traveling, i have encountered several hotels that radically surprise me and some just simply subtle; boring, stench smell, and lacking attention to details. When we stayed at this particular hotel, we had to get a suite with two beds and a pull out bed. the true definition of "suite" entice me because apparently this hotels suite are not even close to being one. First of all,  the location of the room was at the far end of the first floor right next to another room they use for storage of some sort. everytime we walked out, there were people there working on something that made the kids scream and terrified of this people. Second of all, the room was poorly furnish. The desk were missing a drawer, really old microwave and refrigerator. Third of all, the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms, were okay nothing to rave about. Breakfast was a little boring, muffins, sweet donuts, bread & 3 choices of cereal, coffee & watered down OJ. The night attendant on front desk needs a new job, gave us wrong  information so we missed our bus tour. A couple of the rooms have an ant problem, and the keys don't always work. The beds weren't made properly, none of the sheets were tucked in. Was cheap enough and is okay for a couple of days but wouldn't stay there for 10 days again. Shakey's Pizza place next door is a bonus.
Manager Response: none

Summary: 1. We checked into this hotel and requested 2 rooms side by side. I remember calling in at least 10 times two weeks prior to our stay to request that our rooms would be side by side. They were one room apart from each other; not so bad. Rooms 239 and 241.  2. Room 241 had a breeding colony of horseflies. We killed about 5 of them, and speculated about 5 more throughout our stay. They were about 2 inches in length with red eyes = not pleasant. We asked the front desk for bug spray, and their maintenance man was happy to give it to us.  3. Summary Heading: It's not the Ritz, but it works!
Summary: Stayed at this hotel 5 nights while we explored Disneyland.  This is a basic hotel.  The price is inexpensive and what you get for that provides you a place to sleep and shower.  We did not have any problems while there.  The rooms are not up to my standard of cleanliness(because of the carpet) but, I travel with Lysol.  The rooms do need updating and the hotel is older, so they do make the most of what they have to work with.  I bring my own towels, pillows and extra sheets.  Because we stayed longer than just overnight, I went to the laundromat ( just down the street on Ball Street) and washed ALL the hotel bedding in our room.  Quick and easy.  That made for a more comfortable stay for us.  The beds were not bad.  The carpet is in need of replacement and does look dingy.

Summary: After reading some of the negative reviews, I have to assume they have either gotten new owners or management. Very convenient to the park, although I agree that it's not really an easy walk. But you can work with the shuttle schedule if you plan ahead. We were there off-season so it didn't run very often but you get a schedule when you check in. Ask for a second story room if you aren't planning to be up at the crack of dawn - excited kids have heavy feet!  All the employees we encountered were friendly and helpful and the room was very clean. The king size bed was very comfortable, plenty of pillows.

Summary Heading: It was a decent hotel for the price.

The shuttle is a bus and doesn't hold many people, we found it more convienent to take a taxi or drive to the park. The rooms were clean for the most part and the beds were comfortable. The rumors about the carpets are TRUE, you can not walk around barefoot or your feet/socks will turn black.  The complimentary breakfast was good and we enjoyed it every day on our stay.  The pool area is okay but the pool was cold so it should not be advertised as "heated", and they were always out of pool towels, so even though it says do not use towels from your room, I suggest you take them or you won't have any. Summary Heading: Make Sure You know Which Days Inn Your Booking
Summary: We discovered that there are 2 Day's Inns on Harbor, one brand-new one, and the one at 1111 Harbor, the one we stayed in.  I think the pricing on both are similar, and I'd suggest you go to the newer one.  As for the 1111 hotel, it wasn't bad, just really needs to be updated. The carpet was dirty, walls were stained, wallpaper peeling.   The housekeeping was great, they even arranged the kid's stuffed animals on their bed. Suite is a misnomer here, as stated in another review, it's really just an old sofa bed, which was adequate, but needs replacing.  It was a good value, but you can do better, call ahead and ask specifically which hotel you're getting.  The shuttle service was very convenient, and you're about 15 minutes walking distance.  KD

Summary: We stayed for just one night and wished we were staying longer. The room was clean and comfortable. The place looks like a hacienda with lots of hanging baskets and pots of flowers. We enjoyed the continental breakfast which was not fancy but substantial. Two of our party wanted to swim, but the weather the next day prevented it. (Sigh.) We walked to the House of Blues in Downtown Disneyland, ate at the IHOP, and walked back at 2:30 am. The area is safe and well-lit. I couldn't recommend this place more highly. The price was great, the palm trees were lit with colored lights, and everyone was friendly and helpful.  What more could you want?

Our remote for the tv didn't work but we didn't bother complaining especially since we were very tired by the time we got back. We could see the fireworks from the hotel grounds.
